definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: The dying woman panted out her last wishes .
sentences.chinese: 那個垂死的老婦人喘着氣說出了她的遺願。

sentences.english: But faced with the devastating diagnosis, the former TV comic decided there was still much he had left to do.
sentences.chinese: 雖然噩耗當前，前喜劇演員伊斯梅仍然覺得有遺願。

sentences.english: I loved my mom and wanted to respect her last wishes.
sentences.chinese: 我愛我的媽媽，所以打算尊重她的遺願。

sentences.english: She respected her father's last wishes and burned all his photos.
sentences.chinese: 她遵從父親的遺願，將他的相片統統燒掉。

sentences.english: According to his wishes Swithin was buried outside the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 根據他的遺願，把他埋到了教堂外面。

sentences.english: His will was his last laugh at the good-humored expense of his family. Some of the various amusing sections are
sentences.chinese: 他的遺願是他最終的笑聲能是由於家庭的和諧愉快。

sentences.english: I told her about Hanna`s death and her last wishes.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴了她有關漢娜的死和她臨終的遺願。

sentences.english: Ginger sinus informed about LiuShiJian zheng north father's wishes.
sentences.chinese: 姜竇通知了鄭北關於劉時鍵父親的遺願。

sentences.english: The dying man panted out his last wishes.
sentences.chinese: 臨終的人氣喘吁吁地說出他的最終遺願。

definition: to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
